source.title: Iridaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Conn, B.J. (1994). Iridaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Flowers zygomorphic; perianth cream-coloured with fine dark greenish veins; perianth lobes without hyaline margins; primary bracts brown

Flowers almost regular; perianth bright orange to pale pink or rarely light vermilion, flushed deeper pink or yellow in centre or veins deeper pink; perianth lobes with hyaline margins; primary bracts green or brown
Perianth bright orange, orange-red or pinkish-orange, with yellow stripes near base of lobes
Perianth pink to pinkish-orange, deep pink at base of lobes or veins deeper pink
